message.content: i'd like you to replace all the outdated article links that links to https://blog.shoheikawano.com~~ to the latest link which links to the articles in this repo using the path

content.thinking:
The user wants me to replace outdated article links that point to `https://blog.shoheikawano.com` with new links that point to articles in the current repository.

Let me break this down:
1. I need to find all links to `https://blog.shoheikawano.com` in the repository
2. Replace them with links to articles in this repo using the appropriate path

First, I should explore the repository structure to understand:
- What files contain these old links
- What the new article structure looks like in this repo
- How to properly construct the new links

This seems like a multi-step task that would benefit from a todo list. Let me:
1. Search for all occurrences of the old blog URL
2. Understand the new article structure
3. Create a mapping of old URLs to new paths
4. Replace all the links

Let me start by using the TodoWrite tool to plan this task, then search for the old links.

content.text: I'll help you replace the outdated blog links with the new repository-based links. Let me first create a plan and then search for all occurrences of the old links.

todos.content: Search for all occurrences of old blog links
todos.activeForm: Searching for all occurrences of old blog links

todos.content: Understand the new article structure in the repo
todos.activeForm: Understanding the new article structure in the repo

todos.content: Create mapping of old URLs to new paths
todos.activeForm: Creating mapping of old URLs to new paths

todos.content: Replace all old links with new repository-based links
todos.activeForm: Replacing all old links with new repository-based links

content.content: Todos have been modified successfully. Ensure that you continue to use the todo list to track your progress. Please proceed with the current tasks if applicable

content/ja/posts/look_back_february_2019/index.md:21:DroidKaigiについては[こちらの記事](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_droidkaigi_2019)で振り返りをしました。昨年に引き続き、今年も登壇することができたのは嬉しかったです。今年は技術的というよりはエモ的なところに振り切ったので、来年のCFPはより技術的な内容に振り切ったものにしたいです。
content/ja/posts/look_back_droidkaigi_2019/index.md:37:良かったことは、自分が思っているよりも共感してくださる方や、リアクションをくれる方が多かったことです！登壇後、エクシビジョンホールや[Twitter](http://d.hatena.ne.jp/keyword/Twitter)上で質問だったり共感の会話をしたり、[去年](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/02/10/150115)よりもいろいろな方と自分の発表内容について話せたことが、なにより嬉しかったです。
content/ja/posts/look_back_january_2019/index.md:72:あとは[27歳になったり](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/from26_to_27)、ひたすらDroidKaigiの資料作りについて考えていました。

content/en/posts/look_back_2025_the_second_half/index.md:15:You can find my first half retrospective [here](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2025_the_first_half).
content/en/posts/look_back_january_2019/index.md:75:Also, [I turned 27](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/from26_to_27) and was constantly thinking about creating materials for DroidKaigi.
content/en/posts/look_back_february_2019/index.md:22:I looked back on DroidKaigi in [this article](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_droidkaigi_2019). I was happy to be able to speak this year as well, following last year. This year I swung towards emotional content rather than technical, so I want to swing towards more technical content for next year's CFP.
content/en/posts/look_back_january_2021/index.md:32:[Looking Back on January 2020 - heihei blog](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_january_2020)
content/en/posts/look_back_droidkaigi_2019/index.md:40:The good thing was that there were more people who resonated and gave reactions than I expected! After the talk, I was happier than anything to be able to talk about my presentation content with various people in the exhibition hall or on Twitter, through questions or conversations of resonance, more than [last year](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/02/10/150115).

content/en/posts/look_back_2025_the_second_half/index.md:15:You can find my first half retrospective [here](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2025_the_first_half).
content/en/posts/look_back_january_2019/index.md:75:Also, [I turned 27](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/from26_to_27) and was constantly thinking about creating materials for DroidKaigi.
content/en/posts/look_back_february_2019/index.md:22:I looked back on DroidKaigi in [this article](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_droidkaigi_2019). I was happy to be able to speak this year as well, following last year. This year I swung towards emotional content rather than technical, so I want to swing towards more technical content for next year's CFP.
content/en/posts/look_back_january_2021/index.md:32:[Looking Back on January 2020 - heihei blog](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_january_2020)
content/en/posts/look_back_droidkaigi_2019/index.md:40:The good thing was that there were more people who resonated and gave reactions than I expected! After the talk, I was happier than anything to be able to talk about my presentation content with various people in the exhibition hall or on Twitter, through questions or conversations of resonance, more than [last year](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/02/10/150115).

- Old: `https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2020`
- New: Likely `content/ja/posts/look_back_2020/` or similar

- Japanese: `/ja/posts/article-slug/` or similar
- English: `/en/posts/article-slug/` or similar

content.thinking: Good! Now let me check if these articles exist in the repository. I'll look for them in both the ja and en directories.

input.command:
for article in look_back_2020 look_back_2021 from26_to_27 look_back_droidkaigi_2019 look_back_january_2020 look_back_2025_the_first_half look_back_all_2019; do
  if [ -d "content/ja/posts/$article" ]; then
    echo "✓ $article (ja)"
  fi
  if [ -d "content/en/posts/$article" ]; then
    echo "✓ $article (en)"
  fi
done
input.description: Check if articles exist in repo

content.thinking: Great! The articles exist in the repo. Now I need to understand what the proper URL format should be for the new Hugo site. Let me check the Hugo config to understand the URL structure.

content.content:
1→# -- Site Configuration --
     2→# Refer to the theme docs for more details about each of these parameters.
     3→# https://blowfish.page/docs/getting-started/
     4→
     5→theme = "blowfish" # UNCOMMENT THIS LINE
     6→baseURL = "https://shoheikawano.github.io/"
     7→defaultContentLanguage = "en"
     8→defaultContentLanguageInSubdir = true
     9→
    10→# pluralizeListTitles = "true" # hugo function useful for non-english languages, find out more in  https://gohugo.io/getting-started/configuration/#pluralizelisttitles
    11→
    12→enableRobotsTXT = true
    13→summaryLength = 0
    14→
    15→buildDrafts = false
    16→buildFuture = false
    17→
    18→enableEmoji = true
    19→
    20→# googleAnalytics = "G-XXXXXXXXX"
    21→
    22→[pagination]
    23→  pagerSize = 100
    24→
    25→[imaging]
    26→  anchor = 'Center'
    27→
    28→[taxonomies]

file.content:
# -- Site Configuration --
# Refer to the theme docs for more details about each of these parameters.
# https://blowfish.page/docs/getting-started/

theme = "blowfish" # UNCOMMENT THIS LINE
baseURL = "https://shoheikawano.github.io/"
defaultContentLanguage = "en"
defaultContentLanguageInSubdir = true

# pluralizeListTitles = "true" # hugo function useful for non-english languages, find out more in  https://gohugo.io/getting-started/configuration/#pluralizelisttitles

enableRobotsTXT = true
summaryLength = 0

buildDrafts = false
buildFuture = false

enableEmoji = true

# googleAnalytics = "G-XXXXXXXXX"

[pagination]
  pagerSize = 100

[imaging]
  anchor = 'Center'

[taxonomies]
  tag = "tags"
  category = "categories"
  author = "authors"
  series = "series"

[sitemap]
  changefreq = 'daily'
  filename = 'sitemap.xml'
  priority = 0.5

[outputs]
  home = ["HTML", "RSS", "JSON"]

[related]
  threshold = 0
  toLower = false

    [[related.indices]]
        name = "tags"
        weight = 100

    [[related.indices]]
        name = "categories"
        weight = 100

    [[related.indices]]
        name = "series"
        weight = 50

    [[related.indices]]
        name = "authors"
        weight = 20

    [[related.indices]]
        name = "date"
        weight = 10

    [[related.indices]]
      applyFilter = false
      name = 'fragmentrefs'
      type = 'fragments'
      weight = 10

content.thinking:
I can see the baseURL is `https://shoheikawano.github.io/` and `defaultContentLanguageInSubdir = true`, which means the URLs will be structured as:
- English: `https://shoheikawano.github.io/en/posts/article-slug/`
- Japanese: `https://shoheikawano.github.io/ja/posts/article-slug/`

Now I need to create a mapping. Looking at the old links, they're all in Japanese articles (content/ja/posts/) linking to other Japanese articles, or English articles (content/en/posts/) linking to English articles.

The pattern should be:
- Old: `https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_2020`
- New (ja): `/ja/posts/look_back_2020/` (relative link within the same language)
- New (en): `/en/posts/look_back_2020/` (relative link within the same language)

Actually, since Hugo uses relative links, I should use just `/posts/article-slug/` when linking within the same language section, or I can use the full path with the language prefix.

Let me check one of the articles to see how they're currently structured:

file.content:
---
title: "2020年を振り返る"
date: 2020-12-31T19:30:00+09:00
slug: "look_back_2020"
image: "20200930234247.png"
description: "2020年をざっくり振り返る記事です。今年は環境が大きく変わった年でした。ほとんど家にいた年でしたが、引っ越しも行い、旅行も行くところには行って。来年はもっといろいろなところに行きたい。"
draft: false
---

2020年をブログ記事で振り返ります。

(過去記事: [2018](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/2018/12/31/235950), [2019](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_all_2019))

# 1月

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_january_2020)

帰省してあとは映画をたくさんみていたっぽい。
The Frozen 2面白かったな〜

# 2月

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_february_2020)

ぷーちゃんと旅行いったり、妻と山梨いったり、しほしゃんカフェラテをいただいたりしていた。
結構、いろんなとこ行ったりしたなあ。

# 3月

[blog.shoheikawano.com](https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/look_back_march_2020)

content.thinking:
Perfect! I can see the article has a `slug` field in the front matter. For Hugo, the URL structure will be based on:
- Language prefix (ja or en)
- Content section (posts)
- The slug or directory name

So the new URLs should be:
- For Japanese articles: `/ja/posts/look_back_2020/`
- For English articles: `/en/posts/look_back_2020/`

Since these are internal links within the same site, I should use relative paths. When a Japanese article links to another Japanese article, I can use `/ja/posts/article-slug/` or just `/posts/article-slug/` (if Hugo resolves it within the same language context).

Let me check if there's a special case for the date-based URLs like `2018/12/31/235950`. Let me see if that article exists:

Great! So the old URL `/entry/2018/12/31/235950` corresponds to the directory `2018_12_31_235950`. 

Now I have a clear understanding:
1. Old format: `https://blog.shoheikawano.com/entry/ARTICLE_SLUG`
2. New format: `/LANG/posts/ARTICLE_SLUG/` where LANG is either `ja` or `en`

Special case: `/entry/2018/12/31/235950` → `/ja/posts/2018_12_31_235950/`

Now I'll create the mapping and replace all the links. Let me proceed with creating a comprehensive list and then do the replacements.
